question_text:
State whether each of the following sets is finite or infinite:
(i) The set of lines which are parallel to the x-axis
(ii) The set of letters in the English alphabet
(iii) The set of numbers which are multiples of 5
(iv) The set of animals living on the earth
(v) The set of circles passing through the origin (0, 0)
correct_answer: (i) Infinite – every line parallel to the x-axis can be written as y = c, where c ∈ ℝ. (ii) Finite – there are 26 letters. (iii) Infinite – multiples of 5 continue indefinitely. (iv) Finite – at any given time, there is a finite number of animals. (v) Infinite – there are infinitely many circles that can pass through a fixed point.
explanation:
Step 1: Analyze each option:
• (i) Lines parallel to the x-axis have the form y = c for any real number c; since ℝ is infinite, the set is infinite.
• (ii) The English alphabet consists of 26 unique letters, so it is finite.
• (iii) Multiples of 5 take the form 5n for integer n, which are infinite in number.
• (iv) Although the total count of animals is very large, it is bounded by physical and biological constraints; hence, finite.
• (v) A circle passing through (0, 0) can be defined with many different centers and radii, making the set infinite.
